messages.content: Use your postal vote to re-elect Justine as your local MP and to help secure Britain’s future.

issues.economy: Nationally, this General Election comes at a critical point in Britain’s economic recovery and we must keep our country on track.
issues.environment: Justine is also focusing on improving our local air quality through an air quality manifesto which includes opposing a third runway at Heathrow, expanding a second entrance at Putney Station, improving pedestrian routes and working towards quieter and cleaner bus technology.
issues.governance: It would be disastrous to change to a weak Ed Miliband government, controlled by the Scottish Nationalists, with the irresponsible spending and chaos that will entail.
issues.socialWelfare: Since first being elected in 2005, I have worked hard to listen to your priorities and make them my own: I am pushing for better signalling on the district line, extra South West Trains capacity and a modernised Putney Station, including a second entrance.

housing.content: I am also working hard to support our local economy, to get investment in Southfields Village and working with residents on Roehampton regeneration and local jobs.

leaflet.personalStatement: Since first being elected in 2005, I have worked hard to listen to your priorities and make them my own: I am pushing for better signalling on the district line, extra South West Trains capacity and a modernised Putney Station, including a second entrance.
